title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 301.2 - Types of activities allowed
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 301.2 - Types of activities allowed

State Regulations

Consistent with this Part, State property may be used for
the following types of activity: (a) Governmental activities. Activities conducted for the purpose of furthering
better understanding of any level of government operations when conducted by a
local, State or Federal government agency. (b) Educational, cultural or civic
activities. Activities that have a primarily educational, cultural or civic
purpose for the enhancement of the health, welfare and public benefit of the
citizens of the State. (c) Charitable. Activities conducted for the direct benefit of not-for-profit
charitable organizations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
301.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
